documentation_page.description: Documentation layout with sidebar navigation, content area, code blocks, and on-page TOC
documentation_page.html:
üìñ Docs
APIGitHub
Getting Started
IntroductionInstallationQuick Start
Core Concepts
AuthenticationAPI KeysRate LimitingError Handling
API Reference
MessagesCompletionsEmbeddingsFiles

Introduction

Learn how to integrate with our API and start building in minutes.

Overview

Our API provides a simple interface for generating text, code, and structured data. It supports streaming responses, function calling, and multi-modal inputs.

üí° This guide assumes you have an API key. If you don't, sign up here to get one.

Installation

Install the SDK using your preferred package manager:

bash
npm install @appname/sdk

Quick Start

Here's a minimal example to get started:

typescript
import { AppName } from '@appname/sdk';

const client = new AppName({
  apiKey: process.env.APP_API_KEY,
});

const response = await client.messages.create({
  model: 'app-pro',
  max_tokens: 1024,
  messages: [
    { role: 'user', content: 'Hello!' }
  ],
});

console.log(response.content);
‚ö†Ô∏è Never expose your API key in client-side code. Always use environment variables and server-side calls.

Streaming

For long responses, use streaming to get tokens as they're generated:

typescript
const stream = await client.messages.stream({
  model: 'app-pro',
  max_tokens: 1024,
  messages: [
    { role: 'user', content: 'Write a story' }
  ],
});

for await (const chunk of stream) {
  process.stdout.write(chunk.text);
}
